result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
14CF195, 14CF299 and 14CF396.  State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Jim Sempf.  DEF, Marcus Alford apprs in person along with Atty Scott Paley.  Victim in courtroom.  Stip/recomm filed. PQWOR filed on14CF195 and 14CF299.   DEF will be pleading to misd battery (amending on record) in 14CF195, 14CF299 Poss of prescription drug w/o prescription (amending from poss of narcotic drugs) and maintaining drug trafficking place.  All other charges will be dismissed/read in (on all three cases).  Court reviews charges/penalties.  Agreement on expungement - 14CF299 charges if successfully completes probation.  DEF pleads guilty to all counts.  State asks Court to rely on criminal complaint.  Atty Paley does not object.  Court finds factual basis.  Court accepts pleas and finds DEF guilty.  Victim in 14CF195 makes statement.  State heard that no contact order was lifted on 14CF299 and 14CF396.  State makes recomm.  Atty Paley heard/makes recomm with 1 day jail credit.  State files amended information on 14CF195 and 14CF299.  DEF makes statement.  Court heard and no contact, if any to be lifted.  Court orders:  JOC should state no contact order is lifted unless agent sees fit.

W/H Sentence
2 years Probation 
30 days DCJ to commence on or before 3/15/2015 before 6:00 pm - 1 day presentence credit
Court Costs and supervision costs
DNA Sample
AODA Assessment
14CF299 may be expunged if probation is successfully completed
Remove no contact provision (in this case);  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

Defendant Marcus S. Alford in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Review of info is waived; not guilty pleas entered; 20 days mtns; STC set 2/12/15 at 8:15am; Atty. Vollan heard on bond motion filed requesting no contact lifted; victim rights complied with; State does not object in this case; Court modifies the bond in 14CF396 to lift the no contact, but include no violent or abusive contact; State now notes that Def. has 2 other cases that still have no contact privision in place - 14CF299 & 14CF195; 14CF299 is Br. 1 case and 14CF195 is Br. 2 case and both have different attorney; Atty. Vollan will try to speak with that attorney about this issue; Court will also amend bond in 14CF299 (Br. 1 case) to lift the no contact in that case, but notes there is still no contact provision in 14CF195; amended bonds signed in 14CF396 and 14CF195; OOA distributed (14CF195 is set for P&S in Br. 1 on 1/16/15 at 3pm and 14CF299 is set for P&S in Br. 2 on 1/16/15 at 1pm)

Defendant Marcus S. Alford in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews waiver;  Arraignment scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Dodge County Detention Facility Inmate Request to Judge

State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Jim Sempf.  DEF, Marcus Alford does not appr.  Court authorizes warrant, forfeiture of bond and prelim to be removed.  Case recalled 9:15.  State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Jim Sempf.  Atty Greg Vollan apprs for DEF Marcus Alford.  Atty Vollan heard and states he told DEF that he didn't need to appr.  Court quashed warrant, reinstates cash bond and keep prelim scheduled.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Cory S. Smith, dob 9/24/89.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

Defendant Marcus S. Alford in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (jail only - will hire own atty.).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Atty. Vollan questions whether the no contact provision lifted; Court finds probable cause. State requests $750 Cash bond w/condition; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 12/23/14 at 10:00am in Br. 1 & Review 12/17/14 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets bond at $500.00 CASH Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Cory S.Smith, dob 9/24/89.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
